page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT 1.
page.content: High unemployment in this densely populated area of the New Town is a feature of the area. Originally only people who had jobs in the New Town could get a house in the Town. As a result of government subsidies many of the large factories (Industry 1) became seriously overmanned. The closure of these led to severe un- employment - in 1983 44% male and 38% female - with no prospects. Wages are, on average, very low and require two wages for a decent standard of living and so there is a tendency for both husband and wife to work or both not. One child wrote of his day:'I get up at 7-30 my dad has gone to work my mum is still at work my mum works on nights,' Another wrote:'My dad wakes up and makes our breakfast then my mum gets up and they go to digmoor (Post Office) and get the money.'
